ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Composing a large (5-8min) project - I got lots of practice writing melodic/rhythmic/harmonic motives and then playing with them to generate musical ideas. In lessons, I also learned about idiomatic part writing for the specific instruments in my composition. For the smaller portfolio submissions, I learned new techniques of writing for mallet percussion, practiced incorporating modal mixture and non-diatonic pitch collections into compositions, and gained familiarity with Ableton user interface and drum rack.
I learned a lot about techniques for music composition.
Exposure to different types of music & lots of ideas about music composition

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: weekly lessons, semester-long project, portfolio submissions
Weaknesses: I would have preferred fewer guest presentations during weekly seminars. The guest presentations might have been more helpful for the more experienced composers in Comp III, but I would have liked to have spent more time discussing the compositional techniques we used in our portfolio submissions, possibly going over more examples or diving deeper into the topics. Also the first Ableton workshop moved a little fast.

This course is above all, great motivation to work on music composition, which is something I really wanted. The guest speakers are really enjoyable and the private classes are fantastic opportunities for growth. Occasionally I think would have appreciated more direct instruction in lectures rather than almost exclusively guest speakers and presentations, since I think the lectures we did have were very well done, and in addition I would have preferred some more intermediate feedback from the instructor on my ongoing projects.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! If you want to compose music and have the room in your schedule, this is a fantastic course.
